name: Gilbert Ogle
Note: Brought Holy Sepulchre to Sheepwash

name: John Ogle
Note: Lord of Ogle; northern knight and former rebel restored to royal favor. Thoughtful, restrained, and deeply shaped by past defeat, he balances tactical prudence with moral gravity. A father who understands that war is not glory but inheritance.

name: Robert Ogle
Note: Heir of Ogle; later squire and emerging political actor. Devout, reflective, and deeply attuned to place and memory. His moral struggle forms the spine of the narrative: how to remain faithful in a world that sanctifies violence.
Motifs: Marion devoted, foil to Rob Bertram

name: Annabella Selby Ogle
Note: Lady of Ogle Manor. Calm, practical, and emotionally perceptive, she anchors the household in absence and grief. Sees people clearly and early, especially Maggie, whom she quietly claims as family long before vows are spoken.

name: Isabella
Note: Young member of the household. Innocent, observant, and emotionally responsive; a living measure of what must be protected from the consequences of war.

name: John Ogle Jr
Note: Child of the house. Symbol of continuity, hope, and the future that the adults fear to lose.

name: Roger Bertram
Note: Lord of Bothal (until his death). A steady, capable knight; quieter than John Ogle but equally reliable. His death defending the border forces his son abruptly into lordship.

name: Alice Gubium Bertram
Note: motherly, Wife of Roger; sister of Sir Hugh Gubium. Intelligent, politically alert, and shaped by grief. Fiercely protective of her family’s future and deeply unsettled by loss and disorder.

name: Robert Bertram
Note: Heir, then Lord of Bothal. Charismatic, impulsive, and emotionally generous. His arc explores manhood shaped by love rather than ideology, and the cost of choosing the heart over strategy.

name: Gillian/Gyl
Note: on going affair with Robert Bertram, Former tavern worker, later Lady of Bothal. Intelligent, resilient, and emotionally honest. Her arc explores shame, legitimacy, and chosen dignity.

name: Alexander
Note: Huntsman
Age 1298: Died at Stirling Bridge, Maggie's Brother

name: Nigel Morrell
Note: war scarred arms, known for saving Bamburgh castle, father-in-law of Hugh ,Veteran soldier and elder. Hardened by loss, pragmatic to the bone. Values survival, lineage, and preparation over sentiment.
Motifs: Mischievous elder, coming of age initiator

name: Joan Morell Gubion
Note: wife of Hugh, mother of Maggie

name: Hugh Gubium the younger
Note: great swordsman and horseman but hasty, Lord of Shilvington. A seasoned border knight, pragmatic and honorable. His death at Falkirk becomes a moral hinge for multiple characters and reshapes inheritance, marriage, and duty.

name: Maggie Gubium
Note: Daughter and heiress of Sir Hugh. Quietly luminous, devout, and emotionally resilient. A Marian figure whose strength lies in endurance, care, and moral clarity rather than force.
Motifs: Marian, love-lorn war bride, foil to Gillian

name: Father Swineburn
Note: walks with a cane, Parish priest of Whalton. Gentle, principled, and courageous when conscience demands. A steady pastoral presence across baptisms, confessions, and forbidden marriages.

name: Lady Felton
Note: vibrance in step that makes you think she could live forever, Midwife, noblewoman, and liminal figure. Moves between Church and older traditions with calm authority. Speaks prophecy sparingly; acts decisively. Represents memory, fate, and continuity older than institutions.

name: Beatrix
Note: same as Robert Ogle and Bertram, Apprentice to Lady Felton. Quiet, observant, and serious beyond her years. Protector of children and inheritor of older knowledge.
Motifs: Orphan, apprentice, foil to Gilbert Middleton

name: Gilbert Middleton
Note: Page, then squire. Earnest, ambitious, and increasingly radicalized by war. Seeks certainty and validation through authority and violence, standing in stark contrast to Robert’s moral hesitation.
Motifs: Foil to Beatrix, indoctrinated in a zealous manner

name: Walter Selby
Note: Youth of martial inclination. More restrained and conventional than Gilbert; often present at moments of choice and refusal.

name: William Felton
Hair Color: Sable hair, Dark ash colored hair
Note: slightly drunk, zealous, Knight and guardian to Gilbert Middleton. Cold, precise, and ideologically ruthless. Sanctifies violence and embodies the terrifying logic of “holy war.”

name: Sir Denum
Note: Knight and guardian to Gilbert Middleton. Cold, precise, and ideologically ruthless. Sanctifies violence and embodies the terrifying logic of “holy war.”

name: Thomas Grey
Note: "His career, blemished by his suicidal charge at the Battle of Bannockburn, a contributing factor to the devastating English defeat, is perhaps best known for his role in the tale of Sir William Marmion, the chivalric knight of Norham Castle.", Scarred survivor of Scottish war. Motivated by vengeance and survival; serves as grim warning and example.

name: Elias de Martel
Build: Stocky, largest arms he'd ever seen
Note: a blacksmith and goldsmith, Goldsmith of Morpeth. Earthy, skilled craftsman; forges symbols that bind fate and marriage.

name: Aymer de Valence
Note: snobbish, elitist, Earl of Pembroke. Politically resented outsider; symbol of crown favoritism and northern grievance.

name: Humphrey de bohun VI
Note: Lord Constable, third earl of Herford and Essex, Earl of Hereford. Contentious and proud; challenges royal authority over funding and rights.

name: Lord Marshall Roger Bigod V
Note: Earl of Norfolk, Legal-minded and wary of unchecked royal power.

name: John de Warrene
Note: Earl of Surray

name: Richard Fitzallen
Note: Earl of Arundel

name: Baron Henry Percy of Northumberland
Note: Baron

name: Henry de Lacy
Note: well kept mustache, keen intelect, natural talent in marshall sports and art of war, charismatic, Earl of Lincoln, Stabilizing force within royal politics; respected and measured.

name: John De Britagnia
Build: MEDIUM HEIGHT, WELL BUILT, FIT BUT NOT BULKY
Note: not gifted in marshall sport and art of war, loved by king, filthy rich

name: Thomas Earl of Lancaster
Hair Color: wavy blonde parted in middle, beginings of a good beard
Note: II earl of lancaster, one of most powerful men in kingdom, filthy rich, attractive, Earl; powerful magnate and political patron. Calculating, intelligent, and quietly oppositional. Recognizes Robert’s value early and draws him into factional power.

name: Henry of Lancaster
Note: Brother to Thomas. Crude, forceful, and entitled. Represents the danger of power without restraint.

name: Guy Beauchamp
Note: inteligent, skilled swordsman, Earl of Warwick. Principled and blunt; defender of unity and restraint in war.

name: Patrick Dunbar
Build: Short, stocky, powerfully built; well-muscled frame
Note: Duplicitus, earl of march

name: Gilbert de Umfraville
Note: earl of angus

name: Robert de Vere
Demeanor: LONG FACE, STRAIGHT NOSE, CLEAN FEATURES
Note: earl of oxford, owned little land, less power, betroathed to Mary Mortimer

name: Ralph de Monthermer
Note: Married Gilbert de Clairs widow, earl of Gloucester and Hertford

name: Prince Bishop Bek
Note: Prince-Bishop of Durham. Magnificent, intimidating, and politically formidable. Blends genuine faith with absolute authority; frames war as divine mandate.

name: King Edward I
Eye Color: slightly drooping left eye, chesnut brown
Skin: Weathered and sun-browned from years of campaigning; lined, rugged, and slightly pallid with age.
Build: Exceptionally tall (well over 6 feet), long-limbed, broad-shouldered, and powerfully built despite age; a warrior’s frame even late in life.
Demeanor: Towering, relentless, iron-willed; judge-like in presence and expectation.
Note: King of England. Ruthless, brilliant, and relentlessly pragmatic. Frames conquest as order restored and demands absolute commitment.

name: John Langton
Demeanor: lord chancellor, keeper of seal, modest background, well liked
Note: lord chancellor, keeper of seal, modest background, well liked

name: Walter Langton
Note: lord treasure, Bishop of lichfield, speculated to have dabbled in witchcraft

name: Henry of Newark
Note: Archbishop of YORK

name: Edward Chartney
Note: barkeep/tavernowne,knows the gossip from many towns, Owner of the Black Stag. Ambiguous benefactor and predator; emblem of moral compromise tolerated until it threatens the vulnerable.

name: Vicar Goldringe
Note: Vicar of St. Andrews, Clergyman allied with prejudice and institutional power. Uses theology as a weapon to challenge legitimacy and reinforce hierarchy.

name: Mabil Bolam
Note: Maid Of Lady Gillan, Loyal, nurturing, and discreet; offers the safety of female solidarity.

name: Lucas Tailboys
Note: SHERIFF OF NORTHUMBERLAND, Efficient, quiet enforcer of royal will; delivers judgment without spectacle.
